image.altText: A two-storey health centre in suburban Adelaide.

items.synopsis: The South Australian doctors' union says women seeking pregnancy terminations will continue to be consulted in a mouldy and dilapidated building for up to three months.

title.children: Consults to continue in 'dilapidated' Adelaide pregnancy clinic for months

image.altText: Zoe holding a folder. Pauline and Cobie holding a dog. Picture of defect in home.

items.synopsis: Would-be home owners are unable to finish their homes and can't claw back their deposits after a builder linked to a national franchise construction company went into liquidation.

title.children: Pauline and Cobie thought they chose a reputable builder. They were left with a home 'sitting in mid-air'

image.altText: A middle-aged Australian woman of Chinese heritage smiles in front of a dark-curtained background.

items.synopsis: "While you are clothed and fed, you are warm, and you are safe — the safest you'll ever be — you are undergoing, I think, the utmost pain emotionally, psychologically," she tells 7.30.

title.children: 'A sophisticated form of torture': Australian journalist Cheng Lei details her detention in China

image.altText: man in front of a brick wall looking into the camera

items.synopsis: Paedophile teacher Grahame Harold Steele died a decade ago and was never criminally prosecuted. An inquiry has allowed survivor Grant Holland to finally feel heard for the first time.

title.children: A 'hopeless' police sting couldn't bring down Grant's abuser. 48 years later, he's finding validation

image.altText: A man near a door looking at the camera

items.synopsis: The West Bank doesn't usually get a mention in conversations about the world's hottest property markets, but this home is sought after for specific reasons.

title.children: This '$100m house' comes with a problem: Some days, its owners can't leave

image.altText: A man inspects as Palestinians search for casualties at the site of an Israeli strike on a house.

items.synopsis: Israel's total siege of the Gaza Strip has displaced 1.4 million Palestinians and the health authority is warning of disease outbreaks amid the overcrowding.

title.children: Israel claims dozens of Hamas fighters killed as Gazans face deadliest night of bombing, UN says 'clear violations' of international law committed

image.altText: Lee Sedol during the Google DeepMind challenge match

items.synopsis: A board game contest between human and machine in 2016 marked the birth of modern AI. This is the moment the world changed forever.

title.children: 'The most shocking thing I've ever seen in my life': In a single afternoon, modern AI came of age

image.altText: Against a yellow peeling paint background, a person with short fair hair wears industrial sized glasses and a white face mask.

items.synopsis: From coal to asbestos, there's a long and deadly history of dust in Australia. And some are arguing that the lessons of the past aren't being applied today.

title.children: 'They've literally gotten away with murder.' A century on, dust is still killing in Australia

image.altText: A young white boy with intellectual disability. He is in a classroom and being spoken to by a teacher's aide

items.synopsis: Debate has erupted again over the future of special schools following the disability royal commission's final report. Here's why the issue is so complex and personal.

title.children: Some people see special schools as family. Others say they start a cycle of discrimination

image.altText: A mother and son stand with a suitcase under a "Departures" sign in an airport.

items.synopsis: Ibrahim fears for each day that passes with his mother still trapped in Gaza. He says the Australian government has helped to repatriate hundreds from Israel, but that he and others with family trapped in Gaza have not seen the same support.

title.children: 'Living a lie': Family of Australian trapped in Gaza say they are helpless and frustrated at Australia's response

image.altText: A plane wing extends out over the surface of Antarctica

items.synopsis: Using satellite data, researchers uncover an ancient river system hidden for millions of years beneath the East Antarctic Ice Sheet.

title.children: Ancient river system 'hidden in plain sight' below Antarctica's ice could reveal clues about the continent's past and its future

image.altText: Bushfire burning at night

items.synopsis: Police are preparing a report for the coroner after a body was found following bushfires in the Tara area, west of Toowoomba, on Tuesday.

title.children: Police investigating discovery of body as bushfires destroy homes in southern Queensland

image.altText: Anthony Albanese speaks at a podium with Madeleine King behind him by a fence in front of the White House.

items.synopsis: The prime minister uses his Washington visit to announce a boost for mining critical minerals, which are in demand in the US but dominated by China.

title.children: Albanese's $2b mining plan to boost clean energy and counter Chinese dominance

image.altText: A military helicopter lands in bushland, kicking up clouds of dust.

items.synopsis: A broken engine component has been identified as the "primary" cause of an Army helicopter accident in March, but investigators are still working to determine the precise reasons for a crash that killed four soldiers off the Queensland coast several months later.

title.children: Investigations rule out links between fatal Queensland army chopper crash and earlier Jervis Bay incident

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: Bill Shorten at a press conference

items.synopsis: The NDIS regulator commissions an independent inquiry after an ABC investigation found providers had unlawfully restrained children with disabilities in a manner which amounted to a breach of human rights.

title.children: NDIS providers banned and fined $1m, independent review ordered after ABC investigation

image.altText: A woman stands in silhouette in a doorway, cradling her pregnant stomach.

items.synopsis: A tenant who says she miscarried after falling through a hole in the floor of her rental home is suing her former landlord and agency for allegedly breaching a duty of care.

title.children: Woman who alleges she miscarried after falling through Melbourne floor suing real estate agency

image.altText: China's Defence Minister Li Shangfu attends the 20th IISS Shangri-La Dialogue in Singapore.

items.synopsis: General Li Shangfu has been absent from public view for two months, prompting speculation on the cause of his dismissal.

title.children: China ousts shortest-serving defence minister

image.altText: A woman with short orange hair smiles, she wears a shirt with squid reading 'squid squad' she holds her belly.

items.synopsis: Kimberlee Murdoch, a gestational surrogate for a gay couple living hundreds of kilometres away, is "doing it for the dads" trying to start their own family.

title.children: Surrogate mum 'purely baking for friends' as she helps another couple create their own family

image.altText: Malcolm McLeod, Sam Wyatt and Jason Bilney

items.synopsis: Whyalla residents are optimistic — but increasingly impatient — about progress on a hydrogen plant and storage facility planned for their town, following the state government's announcement of its preferred partners for the project.

title.children: Regional SA residents want 'less talk and more action' over proposed $600m hydrogen project

image.altText: A green energy drink can seen from above its pull tab

items.synopsis: Students preparing for exams across Australia are being advised to carefully manage their intake of caffeine, after a pre-exam crackdown by health authorities in one state found energy drinks being sold with almost twice the permissible amount.

title.children: Exam cram warning as one energy drink found to contain 300mg of caffeine per can

image.altText: Riverlea

items.synopsis: The ancestral remains of at least 27 people will be re-buried at a location near the $3 billion Riverlea development in Adelaide's north where they were found earlier this year.

title.children: Aboriginal elders make 'difficult' decision to relocate ancestral remains found at housing development

image.altText: Jar of Vegemite on wooden kitchen table with background blurred.

items.synopsis: No matter if you're a Happy Little Vegemite, or love to test the salty sweetness on your foreign friends, the condiment has a place in all our pantries (or fridge if you're one of those) and in our hearts.

title.children: Iconic Australian spread Vegemite celebrates 100 years on our shelves

image.altText: An elderly lady and a school student looking at school work together

items.synopsis: Retirees on a pension begin to lose it if they earn over $227 a week, yet the rules for older workers are very different in New Zealand. If Australia adopted New Zealand's approach we could have an extra 500,000 willing workers, writes Peter Martin.

title.children: Should more retirees be working? New Zealand could have the answers

image.altText: A blond and white echidna walks along a rocky surface.

items.synopsis: Until he saw one up close, Zach didn't know echidnas could be white. He didn't realise just how lucky he was to spot this "rare" animal in Tasmania's wilderness.

title.children: Sighting of rare white echidna with 'little blond spikes' stops traffic

image.altText: Woman wearing blue shirt stands against a wall with her garden in the background

items.synopsis: Cattle prices have collapsed as producers rush to sell stock before the big dry sets in. But at the supermarket, you wouldn't know it.

title.children: Elke is frustrated you're paying so much for beef when she can't extract a fair price for her cattle

image.altText: A woman in a bright top, with an oxygen tube on her face, looking at the camera, concerned

items.synopsis: Jacqueline has lung disease, asthma, and type 2 diabetes, and her medical centre is one of many struggling to keep the doors open.

title.children: Jacqueline has complex health needs, but her GP is closing and she's worried she won't be able to find a new one

image.altText: An ecologists spreads the wings of a small bird with brown, white and sanding feathers.

items.synopsis: Researchers are now studying the movements of the elusive and endangered Australian painted snipe, after a "sleep deprived" stake out lasting several days in regional New South Wales.

title.children: Scientists tracking 'mystical, ghost-like' bird for first time in hope of learning its secrets

image.altText: Michele Bullock

items.synopsis: Reserve Bank of Australia governor Michele Bullock says the central bank "will not hesitate" to increase the cash rate over fears inflation could take longer to return to target than its current "late 2025" forecast.

title.children: RBA 'will not hesitate' to increase rates if inflation takes longer to return to target than forecast

image.altText: A middle-aged woman crosses her arms and looks unamused in front of the Icelandic flag.

items.synopsis: Across the small island nation, schools and libraries were either closed or operated on limited hours as female staff stayed home, while hospitals said they would only handle emergency cases.

title.children: Icelandic women go on strike for 24 hours over gender inequality — including the prime minister

image.altText: A memorial on Deans Avenue in Christchurch for the shooting victims looks over one of the scenes of the massacre.

items.synopsis: The largest coronial inquest New Zealand has ever held starts to look into the emergency response to the Christchurch terror attacks at two mosques in 2019.

title.children: A coronial inquest into the Christchurch attack will look at what NZ 'may learn from this atrocity'

image.altText: An image of Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson wearing a brown jacket with a white shirt and a black bowtie.

items.synopsis: A French museum says it is working urgently to fix a waxwork of Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson.

title.children: The Rock says French wax figure needs 'updating' over skin tone

image.altText: A wispy, rainbow coloured cloud stretches across a bright blue sky, surrounded by sparse white clouds.

items.synopsis: A perfect storm of conditions sees a unique weather phenomenon form above a Wheatbelt town, lasting for a few fleeting minutes.

title.children: Rarely seen ephemeral cloud iridescence appears above WA country town

image.altText: A composite image of a small joey in a pouch, and joey wearing black carbon-graphite prosthetic on its tail.

items.synopsis: A young kangaroo named Cottontail is given a new lease on life, after part of its tail was amputated when its mother was struck by a car in Queensland.

title.children: Amputee joey now hopping with joy thanks to a shoehorn and some innovative thinking
